newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: SEOUL STOCKS SEEN EDGING LOWER ON CONSOLIDATION.
newsitem.headline: SEOUL STOCKS SEEN EDGING LOWER ON CONSOLIDATION.

text.p: Seoul stocks are expected to fall slightly on Wednesday as a further consolidation is likely in the absence of market-boosting news, brokers said.

"The market needs to consolidate further after sharp gains last week," said Chang Kun-woo of Daishin Securities. "However, the fall would be limited as institutional investors are expected to continue buying," he said.
The composite stock index closed Tuesday down 2.15 points to 762.92.
Brokers expected profit-taking to continue on shares that have risen sharply in the recent rally.
Much of the market's attention would be given to stocks with favourable expectations of first-half earnings, they said. A majority of the company results are due on Friday.
Any development surrounding the troubled Kia Group would again be closely monitored, although investors were growing less sensitive to Kia-related rumours and news in the market, brokers said.
